remarks: Lemma for ~ mul4sq : algebraic manipulations.  The extra assumptions involving ` M ` are for a part of ~ 4sqlem17 which needs to know not just that the product is a sum of squares, but also that it preserves divisibility by ` M ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Jul-2014.)
statement:
4sq.1 $e |- S = { n | E. x e. ZZ E. y e. ZZ E. z e. ZZ E. w e. ZZ n = ( ( ( x ^ 2 ) + ( y ^ 2 ) ) + ( ( z ^ 2 ) + ( w ^ 2 ) ) ) } $.
mul4sq.1 $e |- ( ph -> A e. Z[i] ) $.
mul4sq.2 $e |- ( ph -> B e. Z[i] ) $.
mul4sq.3 $e |- ( ph -> C e. Z[i] ) $.
mul4sq.4 $e |- ( ph -> D e. Z[i] ) $.
mul4sq.5 $e |- X = ( ( ( abs ` A ) ^ 2 ) + ( ( abs ` B ) ^ 2 ) ) $.
mul4sq.6 $e |- Y = ( ( ( abs ` C ) ^ 2 ) + ( ( abs ` D ) ^ 2 ) ) $.
mul4sq.7 $e |- ( ph -> M e. NN ) $.
mul4sq.8 $e |- ( ph -> ( ( A - C ) / M ) e. Z[i] ) $.
mul4sq.9 $e |- ( ph -> ( ( B - D ) / M ) e. Z[i] ) $.
mul4sq.10 $e |- ( ph -> ( X / M ) e. NN0 ) $.
mul4sqlem $p |- ( ph -> ( ( X / M ) x. ( Y / M ) ) e. S ) $.
$d A n $.
$d B n $.
$d C n $.
$d D n $.
$d M n $.
$d S n $.
$d n ph $.
$d n w x y z $.
